CatDescriptText: Mr. Wallace Gaither, porter, Homewood and Mr. Arthur Burnett, Homewood, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, June 17, 1961, pg. 2 with question: "Do you think that courses in race relations should be taught in the public schools?  If so, in what grade do you think they should be taught first?" Wallace Gaither's answer reads: "Yes, I do.  I say the courses should be taught around the later years when the children are about 13 or 14 years of age."  Mr. Arthur Brunett's answer reads: "Yes, I think so.  The instruction should begin in the first grade, so it will be welded into their characters."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Wallace Gaither wearing button down collared shirt with two breast pockets, standing in front of Empire Building, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Arthur Burnett wearing light colored striped short sleeve shirt and hat, standing in front of Empire Building, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
